subtitle: A French style recipe that is so simple to make but do chill well before serving. Look out for low fat curd cheese to keep the calories low.

method.text: Sieve the curd cheese. Beat until smooth with sugar and lemon rind. Press into small pots or moulds (one per person), preferably the sort with perforated bottoms. (If you do not use perforated moulds the finished 'cheese' may be a little wet). Chill for 4 to 1 days.
Make a nick in the stalk end of each peach; dip into boiling water for 45 seconds. Remove with a slotted spoon and slip off the peach skins.
Halve, stone and chop the peaches. Put the peaches into a blender with the lemon juice and white wine and blend until smooth.
Add the Grand Mariner to the peach sauce. If the sauce seems to be too thick, add a little extra white wine.
Unmould each set 'cheese' onto a small plate, and spoon the peach sauce around the base.
Cut the strawberries into slices, taking care not to spoil the green stalks. Fan a strawberry out on top of each cheese and position the stalk decoratively.

title: Fruit cheese
